page.title: 06ATTITUDES OF RIPPINGALE
page.content: The standard of living. Over the past 50 years,conditions have changed greatly,most for the better. This is true in regard to{creature {comforts.}e.g.modern household aids, services such as running water,gas and electricity (which are taken for granted).Central heating,freezers,T.V. radio and the family car are considered necessities.Shorter working hours have provided{increased leisure {time}with more opportunity for hobbies sports and extra education.Few are unable to take an annual holiday,often abroad.Children are healthier through {improved care and medical facilities. Schools have changed and higher {education}is available to most.Social services give a measure of security to the unemployed,the sick and the elderly.In spite of financial cuts our hospitals are the best in the world.
